csharp-11.title: C# 11 – Key features
csharp-11.shortDescription: At a glance: Raw strings, required, list patterns, generic math…

content.overview: C# 11 focuses on readability and productivity. This tip highlights the most useful parts with concise examples for quick adoption.

case1.title: Raw string literals
case1.description: Multiline, no escaping for quotes or backslashes — great for JSON, regex, and snippets.

case2.title: Required members
case2.description: Force property initialization at creation time to avoid incomplete objects.

case3.title: List patterns
case3.description: Concrete example: a tiny router that matches URL segments (prefix, suffix, and captures the rest).

summary.title: Summary
summary.text: Adopt these features where they simplify code and strengthen your API contracts.

goodPractices.title: Best practices
items: Enable analyzers and treat warnings as errors to enforce required
Prefer raw strings for JSON/regex instead of concatenations
Keep patterns readable (avoid overly dense motifs)
